# Question

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.

```julia
using DataFrames

function audi_filter(df_cars)
    filtered_df = filter(row -> 
                                row[:manufacturer] == "audi" &&
                                (row[:model] == "A4" || row[:model] == "A4 quattro")
                            , df_cars)
    
    filtered_df[:audi_a4_ctype] = true
    
    return filtered_df
end
```

This function filters the input DataFrame `df_cars` to rows containing only Audi A4 and Audi A4 Quattro models. It then adds a new column `audi_a4_type`, setting its value as `true` across all filtered rows. Finally, it returns the resulting DataFrame.
